bibl.title: Letter from Louise Fontaine to Henry [Rose Carter], December 26, 1924

div1.p: Fontaine thanks [Carter] for a Christmas gift.

div1.head: Letter from Louise Fontaine to Henry [Rose Carter], December 26, 1924
div1.opener:
MRS. BERKELEY M. FONTAINE
208 WASHINGTON STREET
PORTSMOUTH, VA.
div1.p:
I am sorry that Laura has
been so run down, and glad
that she is better. Give her
our love.

The children and I have had
a very happy Xmas, which is,
as you say, much better than
a merry one.

The family connection - Martins,
Marshalls and Nashes are all
well -- especially “Miss” Catherine
Marshall. She has, however,
recently put on glasses. Although
it seems a pity for such a
young child to have to wear
them, they greatly enhance her
dignity and even add a touch
of severity to her naturally
uncompromising aspect.

Mama and Aunt Sallie
are about as usual. I think
they enjoyed Xmas.

All of us send love to
you and Laura, and hope
that the new year will hold
many blessings for you.
